page.title: 14Grayson's farm
page.content: In the area we visited we found two unusual facts on the farmland. On Grayson's farm Mr Grayson the farmer said that he thought there was a Napoleonic prison camp there. He found chains that might have chained them up at night. Mr Grayson was also of the opinion that the bed of the nearby stream had been built by the French prisoners in the Napoleonic wars. He has also had a shed which is 300 years old and was bombed in the Second World war. While Mr Grayson was building an extension he found a wall and a spit .The spit was underneath the old fireplace and the well was near by. This suggested that a house stood on this sight for many years.
